p: The ecology of begomoviruses identified by HTS studies in non-cultivated plants requires more effort in order to understand the contribution of these plants for disease development [ 74, 75, 76]. Non-cultivated plants could be a source of viral inoculum to cultivated plants [ 77, 78, 79, 80, 81, 82, 83] and could contribute to viral evolution. Here, we described some non-cultivated plants at the agro-ecological interface carrying geminivirus-signatures ( Table 3 and Supplementary Table S2). The information acquired represents important progress towards elucidating the above-mentioned issues, but more work is needed for the validation of the described identities.
